front.title: Signaling DHCPv6 Prefix per Client Availability to Hosts

abstract.t: This document defines a "P" flag in the Prefix Information Option (PIO) of IPv6 Router Advertisements (RAs). The flag is used to indicate that the network prefers that clients use the draft-ietf- v6ops-dhcp-pd-per-device deployment model instead of using individual adresses in the on-link prefix assigned using Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) or DHCPv6 address assignment. This document updates RFC4862 to indicate that the Autonomous flag in a PIO needs to be ignored if the PIO has the P flag set.
